description.narrative:
The project will focus on critical areas that will need to urgently be addressed for Uganda to manage the pandemic well and protectits citizens, their livelihoods, and the economy from the negative impacts of the COVID-19 and related measures to curb its spread. These areas include debt and inequality, relief and recovery and transparency and accountability of COVID-19 vaccines. Oxfam plans to launch the commitment to reducing inequality report 2021; The report shall have a perspective of how Uganda government is performing in using policy to reduce inequalities that have been induced by the current COVID-19 lockdown. The media/advocacy actions will contribute to the following objectives.
Objectives Influence public narrative on the commitments by Government to address inequality.To increase citizens’, demand for accountability hence enhance downward accountability.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security

legacy-data.name: project-name
legacy-data.value: COVID19 and Inequality Influencing in UG

description.narrative: Duty bearers tailor policies & practices towards preparedness & prevention to enable communities & local actors to lead, to engage with civil society, to be accountale towards policies, international agreements & affected communities & vulnerable groups.
cases where duty bearers tailor their policies and practices to enable affected communities and local actors to lead on prevention, preparedness and response to natural disasters and conflict.
cases where local, national and global duty bearers tailor their policies and practices towards preparedness and prevention
